actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 102-445.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 107.
Mr. Roe moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendments by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-261.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: A bill to designate the United States Courthouse located at 15 Lee Street in Montgomery, Alabama, as the "Frank M. Johnson, Jr. United States Courthouse.

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and U.S. courthouse located at 15 Lee Street in Montgomery, Alabama, as the Frank M. Johnson, Jr. Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: A bill to designate the United States Courthouse located at 15 Lee Street in Montgomery, Alabama, as the "Frank M. Johnson, Jr. United States Courthouse.
